column4: I am getting an error because I installed some software and it messed with my java installation.  How can I reinstalled my java sdk to stock specs any help appreciated thanks
what did you install that messed with java?
gcj
gcj
gcj ?? what's that?
gcj is a exe builder for java that is horrible
ah.. now I remember.. uninstall that "offending" program if it isn't already gone then use synaptic to reinstall sun-java6- jre  should fix things up..
alright will give it a go
it is still giving me the gcj reference even after reinstalling sun-java6-jre is that the only installs I should of used?

wild shot in the dark here.. but even after uninstalling a program the configuration file is typically left behind in your home directory as a hidden directory.. open nautilus and ctrl+h to reveal hidden stuff and search for gcj or .gcj
ok will give it a go
found it in usr/lib and deleted that but nothing in my home directory but still same issue
it's got something someplace.. was this program in the repos or from some 3rd party?
third party
but i got it from the repos i mean
repos wouldn't be 3rd party.. how did you uninstall? synaptic?
synaptic
try a "sudo apt-get autoremove" .. probably won't make a difference.. you might have to file a bug about this one.. also check the ubuntuforums.org for more info.
did that and it removed some things, but still same error
I'm stuck.. maybe someone with more experience in that area can help.. sorry but I've run out of ideas.
thanks though
